page.title: 08EAST KILBRIDE ...BASKET FARM
page.content: EAST KILBRIDE...BASKET FARM Basket Farm is situated between East Kilbride and Blantyre; three quarters being in Blantyre and one quarter in East Kilbride.Basket Farm is so called because,when the River Calder,the farm boundary to the west,could not be forded,a basket and pulleys were used to cross.Although the farm is now beef producing,for a short time milk was produced and sold to the Milk Marketing Board.Farm machinery consists of two tractors,a hay bailer and a grass cutter.Only grass is grown for pasture for the 179 beef cattle. Basket Farm was bought by the present owner in 1942.Within the boundaries of Basket Farm are the ruins of a small castle.Early in the 18th century,one of the Maxwell land owners in the town built it for his wife so that he would not have to listen to her nagging!
